channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Leaves Ashtead Road which has loads of trees and is hardly swept unsightly piles upon piles of autumn's old dried out leaves which ruins my road which is a real shame., 17th December
item.description:
Scores of old leaves trapped round and about the wheelies that the road sweepers seem to always ignore, probably those leaves are trapped there from the past few winters since Hackney introduced the wheelies to replace the old bins causing more messy road
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ashtead Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement cracked and dangerous, 17th December
item.description:
The tree besides it may have grown too big and caused one of the pavement tiles to break in half. It is poking out on one side and pedestrians walking at night can and will be tripped and causing danger. In fact the whole area surrounding the tree needs to be fixed as the concrete has risen, dangerous for parking near curb.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clock House Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 17th December
item.description:
